question_text: Which upgrade most directly improves memory throughput in systems constrained by bandwidth?
answer_options: Switching from DDR3 to ECC RAM
Installing memory modules with a lower CAS latency
Using matched pairs of RAM in a multi-channel configuration
Adding more memory modules of varying capacities
correct_answer: Using matched pairs of RAM in a multi-channel configuration
explanation: Multi-channel memory increases the available pathways between RAM and CPU, improving overall memory bandwidth. Matched modules ensure the motherboard can use this feature.
